purpleculture_pinyin:
chuán
to pass on; to spread; to transmit; to infect; to transfer; to circulate; to conduct (electricity)
передать; распространять; передавать; заразить; перевести; распространять; проводить (электричество)

zhuàn
biography; historical narrative; commentaries; relay station
биография; исторический рассказ; комментарии; ретрансляционная станция
rtega_mnemonic:
傳傳RS
传传		伝summon, propagate, transmit
  • person 亻 concentrating 專/专 on something (transmits and propagates ideas) or someone (he needs him, thus he summons him)
  • people 亻 transmit ideas and traditions by talking 云 to each other while walking along each other
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 传)
Pictophonetic: 專 indicates the sound; 亻 (people) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
傳統 [ chuán tǒng ]: tradition; traditional; convention; conventional; Classifiers: 个
傳播 [ chuán bō ]: to disseminate; to propagate; to spread
傳說 [ chuán shuō ]: legend; folklore; to repeat from mouth to mouth; they say that...
傳遞 [ chuán dì ]: to transmit; to pass on to sb else; (math.) transitive
傳記 [ zhuàn jì ]: biography; Classifiers: 篇

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T's specialty is spreading the love and smiling at everyone with his favorite gold teeth.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " Biography " is inscribed from " person " to " special ". The original meaning is the carriage and horse (Xu Shen) set by the post, and later it has the meaning of transmission or biography. "Said the text": "pass, suddenly also from the people, specifically the sound.." Duan Note: "those who pass by, and now it must stagecoach station house, twenty years before mass care." Ancient books handed down " pass " also It refers to the carriages and horses set up in the post, "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Rui, Jun, Chuan Ye." Guo Pu's note: "All the names of the carriage and stage horse." "Zhou Li. Autumn official. "Xing Fu": "The trivial matter of the traveling husband holding the country and the country." Zheng Xuan's note: "The legend is, if you ride the post and ride the post and make the messenger." And "Zuo Zhuan. "Five Years of Cheng Gong": "The Marquis of Jin summoned Bozong." Du pre-note: "Biography, post."

The word " Biography " in the inscriptions may be changed from "辵", " special " or " cun " form omitted; or " cun " is changed to " sword ", please refer to the character form of Wang Minghu for details. The characters of the Warring States Period also changed from "辵", and under the sound symbol "叀", it changed from " kou ". Qin bamboo slips, Han silk scripts, and "Shu Wen" Xiaozhuan use " person " and " special " sound, which are the same as Oracle bone inscriptions.

The meaning of oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, and it is suspected to be used as the original meaning, referring to the post car. "He Ji" 8383: "Chuan Qiu." "He Ji" 9100: "Chuan Yi [白(伯)]", which may refer to the transfer cart to send Bo (Liu Xinglong, Ma Rusen).

Bronze " Biography " is used as the original meaning and refers to the post car. Sanshi disc: "If there are no heart thief from Sanshi, you will be fined a thousand and pass it down." "Heart thief with Sanshi" is the verse of "Heart with thieves and Sanshi". The whole sentence refers to me hurting Sanshi. His heart beat me a thousand times, fined me a daughter, and exiled me in a post car. It also extended to refer to Chuanshe, Post Station, Wang Minglong Festival: "Wang Ming: Ming Chuan (ren) one eaves (cart)", which means Wang Ming: Order the officials of Chuanshe, and give the festival holders a load of food. It is also used as a name to pass on Zha's father Wu Zun: "Zha Zha (as) father Wu Bao Zun Yi."

The " biography " of the bamboo slips of the Warring States period refers to the position of passing, "Guodianjian. "Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 13-14: "Zhan does not pass on", refers to renunciation without passing the position to the heirs. Also " biography " refers to the censorship, "Baoshan Chujian" Jan. 120: "Or kill the Cai Ren She Wei, and the villain will pass it on." The whole sentence refers to or he killed the Cai Ren She Wei, and issued the next request Document to arrest him.

In the handed down documents, " Biography " derives the meaning of Fuxin from the carriages and horses set up at the station, "Zhou Li. Land official. "Siguan": "Whoever bribes the goods will be passed on in verse." Zheng Xuan's note: "Biography, now I have moved the document." From this, " Biography " has the meaning of written records and biography. , "Mencius. Under King Hui of Liang ":" King Xuan asked: "Tom put Jie, King Wu, there are various" Mencius said:? "Have to pass it." "Another" pass "from the inn also extended the set of traveling It has the meaning of transmission and transmission, "Mencius. "Gongsun Chou 1": "The popularity of morality is faster than the postal delivery." The whole sentence refers to the popularity of morality, which is faster than setting up post stations to deliver orders.
humanum_short_description_en: The word " Biography " is inscribed from " people " and " special " in inscriptions. The original meaning is the carriage and horse (Xu Shen) set by the post, and later it has the meaning of transmission or biography.
humanum_full_description:
「傳」字甲金文從「人」，「專」聲。本義是驛站所設的車馬(許慎)，後引申有傳遞或傳記之義。《說文》：「傳，遽也。从人，專聲。」段玉裁注：「按傳者，如今之驛馬。驛必有舍，故曰傳舍。」傳世古籍「傳」亦有指驛站所設的車馬，《爾雅．釋言》：「馹、遽，傳也。」郭璞注：「皆傳車驛馬之名。」《周禮．秋官．行夫》：「行夫掌邦國傳遽之小事。」鄭玄注：「傳遽，若今時乘傳騎驛而使者也。」又《左傳．成公五年》：「晉侯以傳召伯宗。」杜預注：「傳，驛。」

　　金文「傳」字或從「辵」，聲符「專」或省去「寸」形；或改「寸」為「刀」，詳參王命虎符字形。戰國文字亦有從「辵」，聲符「叀」下改從「口」形。秦簡、漢帛書、《說文》小篆則從「人」，「專」聲，與甲骨文同。

　　甲骨文詞義不詳，疑用作本義，指驛車。《合集》8383：「傳丘。」《合集》9100：「傳以𥁑[白(伯)]」，可能指用傳車把𥁑伯送來(劉興隆、馬如森)。

　　金文「傳」用作本義，指驛車。散氏盤：「實余有散氏心賊，則鞭千罰千，傳棄之。」「有散氏心賊」為「有賊散氏心」之倒文，全句指我有傷害散氏的心，則鞭打我千次，罰我千金，以驛車流放我。又引申指傳舍、驛站，王命龍節：「王命：命傳賃(任)一檐(擔)飤之」，意謂王命：命令傳舍的官吏，並給持節者一擔食物。又用作人名，傳乍父戊尊：「傳乍(作)父戊寶尊彝。」

　　戰國竹簡「傳」指傳位，《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡13-14：「禪而不傳」，指禪讓而不傳位予繼嗣。又「傳」指拘傳，《包山楚簡》簡120：「或殺下蔡人佘睪，小人命為棨以傳之。」全句指或者是他殺了下蔡人佘睪，在下請命發出文書以拘捕他。

　　傳世文獻中，「傳」從驛站所設的車馬引申出符信的意思，《周禮．地官．司關》：「凡所達貨賄者，則以節傳出之。」鄭玄注：「傳，如今移過所文書。」由此加以引申，「傳」便有了文字記錄、傳記之義，《孟子．梁惠王下》：「齊宣王問曰：『湯放桀，武王伐紂，有諸？』孟子對曰：『於傳有之。』」另「傳」亦從驛站所設的車馬引申有傳達、傳送之義，《孟子．公孫丑上》：「德之流行，速於置郵而傳命。」全句指德政的流行，比設立驛站而傳遞命令更迅速。
humanum_short_description: 「傳」字甲金文從「人」，「專」聲。本義是驛站所設的車馬(許慎)，後引申有傳遞或傳記之義。

傳傳RS
传传 		伝 summon, propagate, transmit
  • person 亻 concentrating 專/专 on something (transmits and propagates ideas) or someone (he needs him, thus he summons him)
  • people 亻 transmit ideas and traditions by talking 云 to each other while walking along each other
(Simplified: 传)
Pictophonetic: 專 indicates the sound; 亻 (people) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 專 [ zhuān ] concentrated, specialized; to monopolize
①轉(zhu僴)授，遞：傳遞。傳輸。傳戒。傳統。言傳身教。
②推廣，散佈：宣傳。流傳。傳名。傳奇(ａ．中國唐代興起的短篇小說；b．中國明、清兩代盛行的長篇戲曲；c．指情節離奇或人物行爲超乎尋常的故事)。
傳統 [ chuán tǒng ]: tradition; traditional; convention; conventional; Classifiers: 个
傳播 [ chuán bō ]: to disseminate; to propagate; to spread
傳說 [ chuán shuō ]: legend; folklore; to repeat from mouth to mouth; they say that...
傳遞 [ chuán dì ]: to transmit; to pass on to sb else; (math.) transitive
①解說經義的文字：經傳。《左傳》。
②記載某人一生事蹟的文字：小傳。自傳。紀傳。傳記。傳略。樹碑立傳。
③以演述歷史和人物故事爲中心的文學作品：《水滸傳》。
④古代設於驛站的房舍，亦指驛站上所備的馬車：傳舍(供來往行人居住的旅舍)。
傳記 [ zhuàn jì ]: biography; Classifiers: 篇
(Simplified: 传)
Pictophonetic: 專 indicates the sound; 亻 (people) conveys the meaning.

Kanshudo mnemonic:the man (亻) entirely (專) tells you
Chinese: Mr. T's specialties are spread over a wide ranges of skills physical and mental.
Meaning: spread
Hanzi: 传
Story: Mr. T's specialty is spreading the love and smiling at everyone with his favorite gold teeth.
Kind: traditional

「 傳 」字甲金文從「 人 」，「 專 」聲。本義是驛站所設的車馬(許慎)，後引申有傳遞或傳記之義。《說文》：「傳，遽也。从人，專聲。」段玉裁注：「按傳者，如今之驛馬。驛必有舍，故曰傳舍。」傳世古籍「 傳 」亦有指驛站所設的車馬，《爾雅．釋言》：「馹、遽，傳也。」郭璞注：「皆傳車驛馬之名。」《周禮．秋官．行夫》：「行夫掌邦國傳遽之小事。」鄭玄注：「傳遽，若今時乘傳騎驛而使者也。」又《左傳．成公五年》：「晉侯以傳召伯宗。」杜預注：「傳，驛。」 金文「 傳 」字或從「 辵 」，聲符「 專 」或省去「 寸 」形；或改「 寸 」為「 刀 」，詳參王命虎符字形。戰國文字亦有從「 辵 」，聲符「 叀 」下改從「 口 」形。秦簡、漢帛書、《說文》小篆則從「 人 」，「 專 」聲，與甲骨文同。 甲骨文詞義不詳，疑用作本義，指驛車。《合集》8383：「傳丘。」《合集》9100：「傳以𥁑[白(伯)]」，可能指用傳車把𥁑伯送來(劉興隆、馬如森)。 金文「 傳 」用作本義，指驛車。散氏盤：「實余有散氏心賊，則鞭千罰千，傳棄之。」「有散氏心賊」為「有賊散氏心」之倒文，全句指我有傷害散氏的心，則鞭打我千次，罰我千金，以驛車流放我。又引申指傳舍、驛站，王命龍節：「王命：命傳賃(任)一檐(擔)飤之」，意謂王命：命令傳舍的官吏，並給持節者一擔食物。又用作人名，傳乍父戊尊：「傳乍(作)父戊寶尊彝。」 戰國竹簡「 傳 」指傳位，《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡13-14：「禪而不傳」，指禪讓而不傳位予繼嗣。又「 傳 」指拘傳，《包山楚簡》簡120：「或殺下蔡人佘睪，小人命為棨以傳之。」全句指或者是他殺了下蔡人佘睪，在下請命發出文書以拘捕他。 傳世文獻中，「 傳 」從驛站所設的車馬引申出符信的意思，《周禮．地官．司關》：「凡所達貨賄者，則以節傳出之。」鄭玄注：「傳，如今移過所文書。」由此加以引申，「 傳 」便有了文字記錄、傳記之義，《孟子．梁惠王下》：「齊宣王問曰：『湯放桀，武王伐紂，有諸？』孟子對曰：『於傳有之。』」另「 傳 」亦從驛站所設的車馬引申有傳達、傳送之義，《孟子．公孫丑上》：「德之流行，速於置郵而傳命。」全句指德政的流行，比設立驛站而傳遞命令更迅速。

傳字的基本解释

傳
chuán

傳
zhuàn
均见“传”。

傳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chuán］
［《廣韻》直攣切，平仙，澄。］
“传1”的繁体字。
(1)传授。
(2)指所传授的东西。
(3)转授；遗留。
(4)让位；传代。
(5)延续；继承。
(6)传达；传送。
(7)传扬；流布；传播。
(8)传说；传闻。
(9)移动；转移。
(10)说；描述；表达。
(11)以画、写、拓等方式临摹原件。
(12)递解；逮捕。
(13)传讯；召唤。
(14)犹招致。
(15)传染。参见“傳人”。
(16)传导。
(17)通“轉”。改换方向；辗转。
(18)通“專”。集中在一件事上。
[②]［zhuàn］
［《廣韻》直戀切，去線，澄。］
［《廣韻》知戀切，去線，知。］
“传2”的繁体字。
(1)解说；注释。
(2)书传；著作。
(3)传记。指记载个人或群体事迹的文字。
(4)指演述人物故事为中心的文学作品。如《水浒传》、《儿女英雄传》、《虾球传》。
(5)作传；记载。
(6)驿站或驿站的车马。

傳字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　傳； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页114第23
【廣韻】直攣切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】重緣切，?音椽。轉也。【左傳·莊九年】公喪戎路，傳乗而歸。【註】戎路，兵車。傳乗，乗他車。【釋文】傳，直專反。又丁戀反。　又【正韻】授也，續也，布也。【周禮·夏官·訓方氏】誦四方之傳道。【註】傳說往古之事也。讀平聲。　又【禮·曲禮】七十曰老而傳。【註】倦勤，傳家事于子也。　又【禮·內則】父母，舅姑之衣衾，簟席枕几不傳。【註】移也。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?株戀切，專去聲。傳舍。【釋名】傳，轉也。人所止息，去者復來。轉，相傳無常主也。【史記·酈食其傳註】高陽傳舍。　又【說文】遽也，驛遞曰傳。【禮·玉藻】士曰傳遽之臣。【註】驛傳車馬，所以供急遽之令，士賤而給役使，故自稱如此。又古者以車駕馬，乗詣京師，謂之傳車。後又置驛騎，用單馬乗之，若今之遞馬。凡四馬高足爲置傳，四馬中足爲馳傳，四馬下足爲乗傳，一馬二馬爲軺傳。漢律，諸當乗傳及發駕置傳者，皆持尺五寸木傳信，封以御史大夫印章，其乗傳參封之。參，三也。有期會絫封兩

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [chuán]
["Guangyun" Straight, flat and clear. ]
Traditional characters for "传1".
(1) Teaching.
(2) Refers to what is taught.
(3) Delegation; legacy.
(4) Give way; pass on from generation to generation.
(5) Continuation; inheritance.
(6) Convey; transmit.
(7) Spread; spread; spread.
(8) Legends; rumors.
(9) Move; transfer.
(10) Say; describe; express.
(11) Copy the original by painting, writing, and extension.
(12) Deportation; arrest.
(13) Summoning; summoning.
(14) Still incurred.
(15) Infection. See "passage".
(16) Conduction.
(17) Through "turn". Change direction;
(18) Through "special". Focus on one thing.
[②]［zhuàn］
["Guangyun" straight love cut, go to the line, clear. ]
["Guangyun" knows love and cuts, goes to the line, knows. ]
Traditional characters of "传2".
(1) Commentary; comment.
(2) Biography; works.
(3) Biography. Refers to words that record the deeds of individuals or groups.
(4) Refers to literary works centered on the story of characters. Such as "Water Margin", "Heroes of the Sons and Daughters", "Shrimp Ball".
(5) Biography; record.
(6) The post or the carriages and horses of the post.

[Note] Posts pass by carriages and horses, so they provide urgent orders, and the servants are cheap but the servants, so they claim to be so. The ancients used vehicles to drive horses and ride in the capital, which is called the transfer of vehicles. Later, they set up a post and ride on it with a single horse. Where the four horses are high-footed, the four-horse mid-foot is the galloping pass, the four-horse footing is the riding pass, and the one horse and two horses are the Chuan pass. In the Han Dynasty, all the Dangcheng Biography and those who passed the censorship passed the letter with a five-inch wooden ruler, and sealed it with the seal of the official doctor, and the transcript was sealed.
